alert.note: Alert for Graham; Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 10:37PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, southwestern Swain and Graham Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1036 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles east of Madisonville to 8 miles east of Hiawassee. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Robbinsville, Highlands, Town Of Santeetlah, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Lake Santeetlah, Fontana Lake, Nantahala Lake, Fontana Village and Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
